authorName.value: Hindustan Latex Family Planning Promotion Trust

authorAffiliation.value: Hindustan Latex Limited (HLL, a Public Sector Undertaking)

dsDescriptionValue.value:
The objectives of the Behavioural Tracking Survey (BTS) were (1) To measure the major outcomes and impacts of the interventions
funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF) under the Avahan India AIDS Initiative by collecting behavioral trend data in populations targeted by the interventions. (2) To understand the relationship between community mobilization and service indicator outcomes such as promotion of condom use, reduction in violence and improved service utilization. This survey was conducted in the three districts (Krishna, West Godavari, Srikakulam) of Andhra Pradesh.

keywordValue.value: Advocacy, Behavioral tracking surveys with FSWs, Community mobilization, Community mobilization monitoring research (Avahan-CMMR), Female sex workers, HIV, Service utilization, Sexual behavior;  INSTITUTION: HLFPPT; STRATEGIC AREA: FSWs

publicationCitation.value: HLFPPT, 2009. Behavioural Tracking Survey in 4 coastal districts of Andhra Pradesh, Report I, Hyderabad, India: Link

producerName.value: Hindustan Latex Family Planning Promotion Trust

fields.value: Behavioral Tracking Survey (BTS-2010) was conducted among FSWs and MSM to monitor the key components of the HIV prevention programme: safer sex behaviour, STI treatment seeking behaviours and community mobilisation. It was conducted in 4 coastal districts (Krishna, West Godavari, Srikakulam and Vizianagaram) of Andhra Pradesh.  The study involved two stages viz., rapid remapping exercise followed by the sampling and quantitative survey. Probability Proportional to Size (PPS) sampling method was adopted for selection of different clusters. With in different clusters a total of 1989 samples were collected (1189 FSWs and 800 MSMs) in different districts of AP,  Krisna and West Godavari districts both with 400 samples were selected for conducting the MSM data collection, while Krishna, Vizianagaram, Srikakulam  districts were selcted for FSW data collection. The eligible Female Sex Workers (FSW) taken in the study were females aged 18 years or older, either brothel or street or lodge or home based, who sold sex in exchange for cash at least once in the past one month. Whereas Men who have Sex with other Men (MSM) were taken from men aged 18 years or older, who had sex (oral/manual/anal) with other men at least once in the past one month.
